intro: Eurya muricata var. muricata, commonly known as the roughleaf eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are rough to the touch, hence its common name. It produces clusters of small, white flowers that are typically followed by bright red berries. This evergreen shrub is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
